intro: Restrepiopsis carnosa, commonly known as the hairy restrepiopsis, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its hairy stems and leaves. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in montane forests. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
